column5: This museum contains one of the largest known collections of ouija boards. The inside is filled with exhibits that detail the history of talking boards from 1890, until the present day. Visitors can also learn about the pop culture influence surrounding ouija boards. There is also a Victorian-style s√©ance room, complete with a board for you to connect to the other side.
column6: A museum dedicated exclusively to the lore and history of ouija boards.
column8: 127 Essex St; Salem, Massachusetts, 01970; United States
